member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramAlgorithm.SignedDynamicApplicationData

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramGenerator.RequestUnlockCryptogramMaterialForUseAsync(Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardUnlockPromptingBehavior)
member.summary: Requests that previously imported cryptogram material packages be readied for use.
member.returns: An asynchronous operation that completes with an operation status after the prompting behavior is completed.
member.param: The unlock prompting behavior.

member.summary: This method allows the payment app to query the cryptogram generator for proof of material package possession.
member.returns: An asynchronous operation that completes with the material possession proof.
member.param: The prompting behavior to display to the user for validation.
The format of the response.
The material package name.
The material name.

A buffer that contains the confirmation challenge token. The challenge token must consist of UTF-8 characters conformating to the following C# regular expression. ^(?<api>0\d{7})(?<sc>\d+)(?<tvl>\d*[|][0-9a-fA-F]*[|]\d*[|][QM])*$"

member.summary: The material package is JSON Web Encrypted (JWE) by RSA.

member.summary: Gets the result of the proof of possession operation. This field is only valid if the OperationStatus field is Success.
member.returns: A buffer containing the result from a successful proof of possession operation.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramMaterialType
member.summary: Defines the cryptogram material type.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramMaterialType.Aes
member.summary: The material is data that is generated using AES.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramMaterialType.None
member.summary: The material doesn't have a data type.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramMaterialType.RsaPkcs1
member.summary: The material is data that is generated by using RSA according to PKCS #1

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramMaterialType.StaticDataAuthentication
member.summary: The material is static data for authentication.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramMaterialType.TripleDes112
member.summary: The material data is generated using TripleDes112.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementOptions
member.summary: Defines cryptogram placement options.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementOptions.ChainOutput
member.summary: The placement step's output should be chained into the specified step.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementOptions.None
member.summary: The placement option does not have a defined format.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementOptions.UnitsAreInNibbles
member.summary: The CryptogramOffset, TemplateOffset, and CryptogramLength values are in nibbles and not bytes.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep
member.summary: Contains instructions for placing a cryptogram in an outgoing message.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep object.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.Algorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional placement step that will use this placement step's output as an input to the next specified placement step.
member.returns: The target of a chained step. The value must be null if this placement step is not chained.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.ChainedOutputStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the output of this chained step.
member.returns: The output of this chained step.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.CryptogramLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the output to take from the offset.
member.returns: The cryptogram inserted into the outgoing message may not exceed this length. Units may be either bytes or nibbles, based on the UnitsAreInNibbles flag of the CryptogramPlacementOptions property.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.CryptogramMaterialName
member.summary: Gets or sets the cryptogram material name to use when executing this step.
member.returns: The cryptogram material name to use in generating the cryptogram to be placed in this outgoing message.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.CryptogramMaterialPackageName
member.summary: Gets or sets the cryptogram material package name that contains the material specified.
member.returns: The cryptogram material package name in which the named cryptogram material may be found.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.CryptogramOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the data that will be used to generate the cryptogram to be placed in the outgoing message.
member.returns: The offset in the generated cryptogram to begin copying into the message that will be sent. Units may be either bytes or nibbles, based on the UnitsAreInNibbles flag of the CryptogramPlacementOptions field.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.CryptogramPlacementOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the cryptogram placement options.
member.returns: The cryptogram placement options.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.SourceData
member.summary: Gets or sets the data that will be encrypted in this step of chaining cryptograms.
member.returns: The source data.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramPlacementStep.TemplateOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset into the target output buffer at which the generated cryptogram will be placed. Units may be either bytes or nibbles, based on the UnitsAreInNibbles flag of the CryptogramPlacementOptions field.
member.returns: The data template offset.

member.summary: Defines cryptogram storage key algorithms.

member.summary: The storage key is not encrypted.

member.summary: The storage key has hardware protection.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptogramStorageKeyCapabilities.UnlockPrompt

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus
member.summary: Defines the attestation status of a key.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.NoAttestation
member.summary: The key has no attestation.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.SoftwareKeyWithoutTpm
member.summary: The key is a software key on a device without a TPM.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.SoftwareKeyWithTpm
member.summary: The key is a software key on a device with a TPM.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.TpmKeyUnknownAttestationStatus
member.summary: The TPM supporting the key has an unknown attestation status.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.TpmKeyWithAttestation
member.summary: The key is a TPM key with attestation.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.TpmKeyWithLongTermAttestationFailure
member.summary: The key is a TPM key with a long term attestation failure.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.TpmKeyWithoutAttestationCapability
member.summary: The key is a TPM key on a device that does not have the ability to provide attestation.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardCryptographicKeyAttestationStatus.TpmKeyWithTemporaryAttestationFailure
member.summary: The key is a TPM key with a temporary attestation failure.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationCategory
member.summary: Defines the valid categories of smart cards that can be emulated.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationCategory.Other
member.summary: Specifies smart cards other than payment cards, such as a loyalty cards or security badges.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationCategory.Payment
member.summary: Specifies payment cards.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationType
member.summary: Defines the mechanism by which the device emulates a smart card.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationType.EmbeddedSE
member.summary: The device emulates a smart card by forwarding the application protocol data unit (APDU) commands to an embedded SE reader.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationType.Host
member.summary: The device emulates a smart card by forwarding application protocol data unit (APDU) commands to the host application, which responds back.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulationType.Uicc
member.summary: The device emulates a smart card by forwarding the application protocol data unit (APDU) commands directly to the physical UICC card. The UICC card is more commonly referred to as the SIM card.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator
member.summary: Represents a smart card emulator device.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.EnablementPolicy
member.summary: Gets the current card emulation policy set by the user.
member.returns: The current card emulation policy set by the user through the phone settings. This property is read-only to the app; you should tell the user to change the card emulation policy in the settings on his or her phone, if their mobile operator allows it.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.MaxAppletIdGroupRegistrations
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of permitted applet ID group registrations.
member.returns: The maximum number of permitted applet ID group registrations.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.ApduReceived
member.summary: Occurs when an application protocol data unit (APDU) is received by the NFC controller.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.ConnectionDeactivated
member.summary: Occurs when the connection with the device is physically broken or when the NFC reader requests a connection to a different app.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.GetAppletIdGroupRegistrationsAsync
member.summary: Gets the registered applet identifier groups for this smart card, asynchronously.
member.returns: The registered applet identifier groups for this smart card.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.GetDefaultAsync
member.summary: Returns the SmartCardEmulator object representing the default smart card emulator device.
member.returns: After the asynchronous operation completes, returns the default smart card emulator or null if there is no smart card emulator present.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.IsHostCardEmulationSupported
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating if host card emulation is supported by this device.
member.returns: True if host card emulation is supported by this device.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.RegisterAppletIdGroupAsync(Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroup)
member.summary: Asynchronously registers a group of applet IDs.
member.returns: The group of registered applet IDs.
member.param: The group of applet IDs to register.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.Start
member.summary: Starts the smart card emulator. This method must be called from a background task.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulator.UnregisterAppletIdGroupAsync(Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardAppletIdGroupRegistration)
member.summary: Asynchronously unregisters a previously registered group of applet IDs.
member.returns: An IAsyncAction object that is used to control the asynchronous operation.
member.param: The previously registered group of applet IDs.

member.summary: Provides data for the ApduReceived event.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorApduReceivedEventArgs.AutomaticResponseStatus
member.summary: Gets a SmartCardAutomaticResponseStatus object indicating the automatic response was already successfully sent (Success), attempted but failed (UnknownError), or was not matched with any auto-responder rule (None).
member.returns: The object indicating the status of the automatic response.

member.summary: Represents an application protocol data unit (APDU) command sent by an NFC reader.
member.returns: An application protocol data unit (APDU) command sent by an NFC reader.

member.summary: Gets the state.
member.returns: The state.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorApduReceivedEventArgs.TryRespondAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer)
member.summary: Attempts to respond to an APDU.
member.returns: Returns an asynchronous operation that returns a boolean when the operation completes indicating. The boolean will be true if the operation was successful and false otherwise.
member.param: A buffer containing the response.

member.summary: Defines the reasons a smart card connection to an NFC reader could become deactivated.

member.summary: The physical connection to the reader was lost.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorConnectionDeactivatedReason.ConnectionRedirected
member.summary: The connection is redirected to another app due to reader terminal selecting a different application identifier which resolves to a different app.

member.summary: Card emulation is always on.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorEnablementPolicy.Never
member.summary: Card emulation is disabled.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorEnablementPolicy.ScreenOn
member.summary: Card emulation is only on when the phone screen is on.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.SmartCards.SmartCardEmulatorEnablementPolicy.ScreenUnlocked
